meanings.definition: A line at the beginning of a newspaper or magazine article giving the writer's name
meanings.sent1: The bylines in the newspaper help us know who wrote each article.
meanings.sent2: I always look for the bylines to see who wrote my favorite stories.
meanings.sent3: The detective's bylines in the mystery novel were cleverly hidden clues.
meanings.sent4: Her bylines were like breadcrumbs leading us through the story.
meanings.sent5: The bylines stood out like bright signposts in the sea of text.

meanings.definition: A line at the beginning of a movie or television show giving the writer's name
meanings.sent1: During the credits, I always pay attention to the bylines for the film.
meanings.sent2: The bylines at the start of the show highlighted the talented writers.
meanings.sent3: The bylines in the movie credits seemed to dance across the screen.
meanings.sent4: His bylines in the film were like hidden gems waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The bylines shone brightly, recognizing the writers' contributions.
